ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Generates a spline scatter-line chart in code
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Generates a spline scatter-line chart in code. Uses the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.RenderableSeries.CustomRenderableSeries.html']CustomRenderableSeries[/url] type to demonstrate how to create your own series types. Here we implement a Cubic Spline line series with optional scatter points.
[b][i]Tips![/i][/b]
As well as Stroke, you can set [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17175/28/Stroke-and-strokethickness']StrokeThickness[/url], [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17178/28/antialiasing-or-no-antialiasing']AntiAliasing[/url], [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17179/28/showing-or-hiding-a-renderableseries']IsVisible[/url] properties to change how the series is rendered.[
You can add data-point markers to a line series using the [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17182/28/adding-data-pointmarkers']PointMarker API[/url]. This is very performant and uses the same bitmap rendering as our Scatter-Charts.
